oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Burn. Telegram to Mrs. George Fort Milton.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Telegram to Mrs. George Fort Milton, Nashville, TN, with message for Harry T. Burns (sic.) from supporters in Niota, TN. #C 134. August 19, 1920.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Women's suffrage; Politics & government; Telegrams;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: C.M. McClung Historical Collection, Knox County Public Library
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814. Please provide a brief description of the material.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
WESTERN UNION TELEGRAM
RECEIVED AT A250G 94 COLLECT NL 40 EXTRA NIOTA TENN AUG 18 1920 Aug 19 AM 3 41 #C 134 MRS GEORGE FORT MILTON NASHVILLE TENN KNOWING HON HARRY T BURNS IS VERY BUSY PLEASE DELIVER THIS MESSAGE DEAR HARRY ALL OF US IN YOUR HOME TOWN ARE DELIGHTED YOU SUPPORTED WOMAN SUFFRAGE DO YOUR UTMOST UNTIL ALL DANGER IS PAST PAY NO ATTENTION TO D M OWEN ERICKSON G L RAY FISHER AND OTHERS OF ATHENS TENN
MR AND MRS C B STALEY MRS LIZZIE REAGAN MR AND MRS H A COTTON MR AND MRS L A LARGE MRS DR CAMEY MRS DR MCGASSEY JAMES SLACK MR AND MRS E M MONTGOMERY MISS FANNIE BURNETT WILLIAM SNYDER MRS A B BROCK MISSES WILLSON. 1920 Aug 19 AM 3 55
